that how he spells it?). I have loved him since his tv show...shoot can't remember the
name now.....

Stephanie E.

Alan Rickman

and I cannot remember if G Byrne was in it as well.

Liza

Jersey and has two little black Irish heartthrobs called Evan Michael
and Aidan Gabriel
:-)

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Letching
messages.msgSnippet: ... I think it s the way his eyes sparkle and crinkle and that little smirk he gets for a smile and the way he sometimes cocks his head to one side just a bit
messages.messageBody:
At 02:55 PM 11/4/2002 -0800, you wrote:
> >I still think Jean-Luc Picard is the hottest thing in
> >space.

I think it's the way his eyes sparkle and crinkle and that little smirk he
gets for a smile and the way he sometimes cocks his head to one side just a
bit - and of course, the way he *never* denigrates anybody and always pulls
everyone out of the jam without loosing his cool - while looking good in
those form fitting fleet uniforms....
Ah, yes, where was I?

It might help matters that I thought Yul Brenner was pretty hot and of
course, I married a man who's going bald faster than not.

messages.subject: [AlwaysLearning] Letching
messages.msgSnippet: ... Oh yes, that was a good movie.  Gabriel as a gypsy if I recall correctly, it s been a while. Hey what s all this guilt about enjoying actors?  I thought
messages.messageBody:
>Mmmmmmm.... ever see "Into the West"? Horses AND
>Gabriel Byrne <g>
>Nancy, who really has to get offline today!

Oh yes, that was a good movie. Gabriel as a gypsy if
I recall correctly, it's been a while.

Hey what's all this guilt about enjoying actors? I
thought this is what Hollywood was all about, the
Modern Western Mythology. Besides, guilt tastes bad.

Nanci K.

messages.subject: [AlwaysLearning] Letching
messages.msgSnippet: ... (sigh)  what is it about him?  That cool collectedness that we know is just barely covering a passionate side (see his enraged Ahab Jean-Luc in First
messages.messageBody:
>I still think Jean-Luc Picard is the hottest thing in
>space.
>Nancy

(sigh) what is it about him? That cool collectedness
that we know is just barely covering a passionate side
(see his enraged "Ahab" Jean-Luc in First Contact) or
the gentleman with the commanding presence (Make it
so!) or the accent? I saw him do a bit on Seasame
Street once, LOL, where he is wearing an Elizabethan
collar and harkening back to his Shakespearean theater
days by holding a letter B and spout "To B or not to
B..." etc. He's in good company. I did a Sesame
Street bit once too, when I worked at the zoo as a
teen and I was talking about snakes and showing some
to some kids. My sister saw it and called to tease me
about it, but I wanted to know why she was watching
Seasame Street before they had any kids... :)

Nanci K.

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Letching
messages.msgSnippet: ... Mmmmmmm.... ever see Into the West ?  Horses AND Gabriel Byrne  Then there s The Man from Snowy River ... Horses AND Tom Burlinson... Nancy, who

> Ooooo, yeah, Val and Richard Dean Anderson. But no
> one has said a thing about Liam Neeson (I love tall
> guys) and Gabriel Byrne, two more fantastic voices,
> and smoldering presences. mmmmmm

Mmmmmmm.... ever see "Into the West"? Horses AND Gabriel Byrne <g>

Then there's "The Man from Snowy River"... Horses AND Tom Burlinson...

Nancy, who really has to get offline today!

messages.subject: [AlwaysLearning] Letching
messages.msgSnippet: ... Ooooo, yeah, Val and Richard Dean Anderson.  But no one has said a thing about Liam Neeson (I love tall guys) and Gabriel Byrne, two more fantastic voices,
messages.messageBody:
>Oh, hang on...Val Kilmer is still here is he not?
>And Richard Dean Anderson.....maybe I'll stay
>awhile....
>Shyrley

Ooooo, yeah, Val and Richard Dean Anderson. But no
one has said a thing about Liam Neeson (I love tall
guys) and Gabriel Byrne, two more fantastic voices,
and smoldering presences. mmmmmm

Nanci K.
